ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function

Class LineageDotRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function.LineageDotRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderer

    public class LineageDotRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderer
    Renders a graph produced by a call to ExplanationQueryable.getExplanation(Part) as an input file in the DOT format used by Graphviz.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

      The set of nodes that have been expanded (nodes that had their children rendered).

    • Field Detail

      • m_roots

        protected java.util.List<Node> m_roots
        The nodes used as the starting point for the rendering.

      • m_nodeIds

        protected java.util.Map<Node,java.lang.String> m_nodeIds
        A map associating node instances to their uniquely generated ID.

      • m_rendered

        protected java.util.Set<Node> m_rendered
        The set of nodes that have been rendered. Used internally by the renderer to avoid outputting code for the same node when encountered multiple times in the traversal of the graph.

      • m_expanded

        protected java.util.Set<Node> m_expanded
        The set of nodes that have been expanded (nodes that had their children rendered). Used internally by the renderer to avoid expanding the same node when encountered multiple times in the traversal of the graph.

      • m_prefix

        protected java.lang.String m_prefix
        The prefix to give to each node ID in the graph.

      • m_indent

        protected java.lang.String m_indent
        The prefix to give to each node ID in the graph.

      • m_leaves

        protected java.util.List<Node> m_leaves
        The nodes that corresponds to he leaves of the graph.

      • m_idCounter

        protected int m_idCounter
        A counter used to give unique IDs to each new node encountered in the graph.

      • m_nestingLevel

        protected int m_nestingLevel
        The nesting level of this graph.

      • m_noCaptions

        protected boolean m_noCaptions
        Flag that determines if the captions of non-leaf nodes should be printed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LineageDotRenderer

        public LineageDotRenderer(java.util.List<Node> roots,
                          java.lang.String prefix,
                          int nesting_level,
                          boolean no_captions)
        Creates a new instance of renderer.
        Parameters:
        roots - The nodes used as the starting point for the rendering. These are typically the roots of a directed acyclic graph.
        prefix - The prefix to give to each node ID in the graph
        nesting_level - The nesting level of this graph
        no_captions - Flag that determines if the captions of non-leaf nodes should be printed. If set to true, these nodes will simply be rendered as colored circles.

      • LineageDotRenderer

        public LineageDotRenderer(Node root,
                          java.lang.String prefix,
                          int nesting_level,
                          boolean no_captions)
        Creates a new instance of renderer.
        Parameters:
        root - The node used as the starting point for the rendering. This is typically the root of a directed acyclic graph.
        prefix - The prefix to give to each node ID in the graph
        nesting_level - The nesting level of this graph
        no_captions - Flag that determines if the captions of non-leaf nodes should be printed. If set to true, these nodes will simply be rendered as colored circles.

      • getBackgroundColor

        protected static java.lang.String getBackgroundColor(int nesting_level)
        Gets the background color of the sub-graph associated to a given nesting level. This method has a purely cosmetic effect: it results in increasingly nested sub-graphs to be pained against increasingly darker backgrounds to better distinguish them.
        Parameters:
        nesting_level - The level of nesting
        Returns:
        The background color associated to this nesting level

      • getPartNodeColor

        protected static java.lang.String getPartNodeColor(Part p)
        Gets the background color of a part node.
        Parameters:
        p - The part
        Returns:
        The color this node is assigned to

      • getIndent

        protected static java.lang.String getIndent(int nesting_level)
        Gets the indent to apply to each line of code depending on the renderrer's nesting level. The goal of this method is simply to make the output file minimally human-readable.
        Parameters:
        nesting_level - The level of nesting of this renderer
        Returns:
        A string with the appropriate number of indents
